text: Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: For knowing wisdom and instruction, For understanding sayings of intelligence,
speaker: Narrator

text: For receiving the instruction of wisdom, Righteousness, judgment, and uprightness,
speaker: Narrator

text: For giving to simple ones -- prudence, To a youth -- knowledge and discretion.
speaker: Narrator

text: (The wise doth hear and increaseth learning, And the intelligent doth obtain counsels.)
speaker: Narrator

text: For understanding a proverb and its sweetness, Words of the wise and their acute sayings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear of Jehovah [is] a beginning of knowledge, Wisdom and instruction fools have despised!
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father, And leave not the law of thy mother,
speaker: Narrator

text: For a graceful wreath [are] they to thy head, And chains to thy neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, if sinners entice thee be not willing.
speaker: Narrator

text: If they say, `Come with us, we lay wait for blood, We watch secretly for the innocent without cause,
speaker: Narrator

text: We swallow them as Sheol -- alive, And whole -- as those going down [to] the pit,
speaker: Narrator

text: Every precious substance we find, We fill our houses [with] spoil,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy lot thou dost cast among us, One purse is -- to all of us.'
speaker: Narrator

text: My son! go not in the way with them, Withhold thy foot from their path,
speaker: Narrator

text: For their feet to evil do run, And they haste to shed blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely in vain is the net spread out before the eyes of any bird.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they for their own blood lay wait, They watch secretly for their own lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: So [are] the paths of every gainer of dishonest gain, The life of its owners it taketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wisdom in an out-place crieth aloud, In broad places she giveth forth her voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: At the head of the multitudes she calleth, In the openings of the gates, In the city her sayings she saith:
speaker: Narrator

text: `Till when, ye simple, do ye love simplicity? And have scorners their scorning desired? And do fools hate knowledge?
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn back at my reproof, lo, I pour forth to you my spirit, I make known my words with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because I have called, and ye refuse, I stretched out my hand, and none is attending,
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye slight all my counsel, And my reproof ye have not desired.
speaker: Narrator

text: I also in your calamity do laugh, I deride when your fear cometh,
speaker: Narrator

text: When your fear cometh as destruction, And your calamity as a hurricane doth come, When on you come adversity and distress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they call me, and I do not answer, They seek me earnestly, and find me not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because that they have hated knowledge, And the fear of Jehovah have not chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have not consented to my counsel, They have despised all my reproof,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they eat of the fruit of their way, And from their own counsels they are filled.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the turning of the simple slayeth them, And the security of the foolish destroyeth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoso is hearkening to me dwelleth confidently, And [is] quiet from fear of evil!'
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, if thou dost accept my sayings, And my commands dost lay up with thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: To cause thine ear to attend to wisdom, Thou inclinest thy heart to understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text: For, if for intelligence thou callest, For understanding givest forth thy voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou dost seek her as silver, And as hid treasures searchest for her,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then understandest thou fear of Jehovah, And knowledge of God thou findest.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah giveth wisdom, From His mouth knowledge and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even to lay up for the upright substance, A shield for those walking uprightly.
speaker: Narrator

text: To keep the paths of judgment, And the way of His saints He preserveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then understandest thou righteousness, And judgment, and uprightness -- every good path.
speaker: Narrator

text: For wisdom cometh into thy heart, And knowledge to thy soul is pleasant,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thoughtfulness doth watch over thee, Understanding doth keep thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: To deliver thee from an evil way, From any speaking froward things,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who are forsaking paths of uprightness, To walk in ways of darkness,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who are rejoicing to do evil, They delight in frowardness of the wicked,
speaker: Narrator

text: Whose paths [are] crooked, Yea, they are perverted in their ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: To deliver thee from the strange woman, From the stranger who hath made smooth her sayings,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is forsaking the guide of her youth, And the covenant of her God hath forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: For her house hath inclined unto death, And unto Rephaim her paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: None going in unto her turn back, Nor do they reach the paths of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou dost go in the way of the good, And the paths of the righteous dost keep.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the upright do inhabit the earth, And the perfect are left in it,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the wicked from the earth are cut off, And treacherous dealers plucked out of it!
speaker: Narrator

text: My son! my law forget not, And my commands let thy heart keep,
speaker: Narrator

text: For length of days and years, Life and peace they do add to thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not kindness and truth forsake thee, Bind them on thy neck, Write them on the tablet of thy heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: And find grace and good understanding In the eyes of God and man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust unto Jehovah with all thy heart, And unto thine own understanding lean not.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all thy ways know thou Him, And He doth make straight thy paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not wise in thine own eyes, Fear Jehovah, and turn aside from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Healing it is to thy navel, And moistening to thy bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honour Jehovah from thy substance, And from the beginning of all thine increase;
speaker: Narrator

text: And filled are thy barns [with] plenty, And [with] new wine thy presses break forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chastisement of Jehovah, my son, despise not, And be not vexed with His reproof,
speaker: Narrator

text: For whom Jehovah loveth He reproveth, Even as a father the son He is pleased with.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of a man [who] hath found wisdom, And of a man [who] bringeth forth understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: For better [is] her merchandise Than the merchandise of silver, And than gold -- her increase.
speaker: Narrator

text: Precious she [is] above rubies, And all thy pleasures are not comparable to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Length of days [is] in her right hand, In her left [are] wealth and honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her ways [are] ways of pleasantness, And all her paths [are] peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: A tree of life she [is] to those laying hold on her, And whoso is retaining her [is] happy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah by wisdom did found the earth, He prepared the heavens by understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: By His knowledge depths have been rent, And clouds do drop dew.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son! let them not turn from thine eyes, Keep thou wisdom and thoughtfulness,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they are life to thy soul, and grace to thy neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou goest thy way confidently, And thy foot doth not stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou liest down, thou art not afraid, Yea, thou hast lain down, And sweet hath been thy sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, And of the desolation of the wicked when it cometh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah is at thy side, And He hath kept thy foot from capture.
speaker: Narrator

text: Withhold not good from its owners, When thy hand [is] toward God to do [it].
speaker: Narrator

text: Say not thou to thy friend, `Go, and return, and to-morrow I give,' And substance with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Devise not against thy neighbour evil, And he sitting confidently with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Strive not with a man without cause, If he have not done thee evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not envious of a man of violence, Nor fix thou on any of his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: For an abomination to Jehovah [is] the perverted, And with the upright [is] His secret counsel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The curse of Jehovah [is] in the house of the wicked. And the habitation of the righteous He blesseth.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the scorners He doth scorn, Yet to the humble He doth give grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honour do the wise inherit, And fools are bearing away shame!
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, ye sons, the instruction of a father, And give attention to know understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: For good learning I have given to you, My law forsake not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, a son I have been to my father -- tender, And an only one before my mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he directeth me, and he saith to me: `Let thy heart retain my words, Keep my commands, and live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Get wisdom, get understanding, Do not forget, nor turn away From the sayings of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forsake her not, and she doth preserve thee, Love her, and she doth keep thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first thing [is] wisdom -- get wisdom, And with all thy getting get understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt her, and she doth lift thee up, She honoureth thee, when thou dost embrace her.
speaker: Narrator

text: She giveth to thy head a wreath of grace, A crown of beauty she doth give thee freely.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, my son, and receive my sayings, And years of life [are] multiplied to thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a way of wisdom I have directed thee, I have caused thee to tread in paths of uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: In thy walking thy step is not straitened, And if thou runnest, thou stumblest not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lay hold on instruction, do not desist, Keep her, for she [is] thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Into the path of the wicked enter not, And be not happy in a way of evil doers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Avoid it, pass not over into it, Turn aside from it, and pass on.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they sleep not if they do not evil, And their sleep hath been taken violently away, If they cause not [some] to stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have eaten bread of wickedness, And wine of violence they drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the path of the righteous [is] as a shining light, Going and brightening till the day is established,
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of the wicked [is] as darkness, They have not known at what they stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, to my words give attention, To my sayings incline thine ear,
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them not turn aside from thine eyes, Preserve them in the midst of thy heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For life they [are] to those finding them, And to all their flesh healing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above every charge keep thy heart, For out of it [are] the outgoings of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn aside from thee a froward mouth, And perverse lips put far from thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine eyes do look straightforward, And thine eyelids look straight before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ponder thou the path of thy feet, And all thy ways [are] established.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline not [to] the right or to the left, Turn aside thy foot from evil!
speaker: Narrator

text: My son! to my wisdom give attention, To mine understanding incline thine ear,
speaker: Narrator

text: To observe thoughtfulness, And knowledge do thy lips keep.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the lips of a strange woman drop honey, And smoother than oil [is] her mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And her latter end [is] bitter as wormwood, Sharp as a sword [with] mouths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her feet are going down to death, Sheol do her steps take hold of.
speaker: Narrator

text: The path of life -- lest thou ponder, Moved have her paths -- thou knowest not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, ye sons, hearken to me, And turn not from sayings of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep far from off her thy way, And come not near unto the opening of her house,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest thou give to others thy honour, And thy years to the fierce,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest strangers be filled [with] thy power, And thy labours in the house of a stranger,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou hast howled in thy latter end, In the consumption of thy flesh and thy food,
speaker: Narrator

text: And hast said, `How have I hated instruction, And reproof hath my heart despised,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have not hearkened to the voice of my directors, And to my teachers have not inclined mine ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a little thing I have been all evil, In the midst of an assembly and a company.
speaker: Narrator

text: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, Even flowing ones out of thine own well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy fountains be scattered abroad, In broad places rivulets of waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be to thee for thyself, And not to strangers with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy fountain be blessed, And rejoice because of the wife of thy youth,
speaker: Narrator

text: A hind of loves, and a roe of grace! Let her loves satisfy thee at all times, In her love magnify thyself continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: And why dost thou magnify thyself, My son, with a stranger? And embrace the bosom of a strange woman?
speaker: Narrator

text: For over-against the eyes of Jehovah are the ways of each, And all his paths He is pondering.
speaker: Narrator

text: His own iniquities do capture the wicked, And with the ropes of his sin he is holden.
speaker: Narrator

text: He dieth without instruction, And in the abundance of his folly magnifieth himself!
speaker: Narrator

text: My son! if thou hast been surety for thy friend, Hast stricken for a stranger thy hand,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hast been snared with sayings of thy mouth, Hast been captured with sayings of thy mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Do this now, my son, and be delivered, For thou hast come into the hand of thy friend. Go, trample on thyself, and strengthen thy friend,
speaker: Narrator

text: Give not sleep to thine eyes, And slumber to thine eyelids,
speaker: Narrator

text: Be delivered as a roe from the hand, And as a bird from the hand of a fowler.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go unto the ant, O slothful one, See her ways and be wise;
speaker: Narrator

text: Which hath not captain, overseer, and ruler,
speaker: Narrator

text: She doth prepare in summer her bread, She hath gathered in harvest her food.
speaker: Narrator

text: Till when, O slothful one, dost thou lie? When dost thou arise from thy sleep?
speaker: Narrator

text: A little sleep, a little slumber, A little clasping of the hands to rest,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy poverty hath come as a traveller, And thy want as an armed man.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man of worthlessness, a man of iniquity, Walking [with] perverseness of mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Winking with his eyes, speaking with his feet, Directing with his fingers,
speaker: Narrator

text: Frowardness [is] in his heart, devising evil at all times, Contentions he sendeth forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore suddenly cometh his calamity, Instantly he is broken -- and no healing.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six hath Jehovah hated, Yea, seven [are] abominations to His soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eyes high -- tongues false -- And hands shedding innocent blood --
speaker: Narrator

text: A heart devising thoughts of vanity -- Feet hasting to run to evil --
speaker: Narrator

text: A false witness [who] doth breathe out lies -- And one sending forth contentions between brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep, my son, the command of thy father, And leave not the law of thy mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bind them on thy heart continually, Tie them on thy neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: In thy going up and down, it leadeth thee, In thy lying down, it watcheth over thee, And thou hast awaked -- it talketh [with] thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a lamp [is] the command, And the law a light, And a way of life [are] reproofs of instruction,
speaker: Narrator

text: To preserve thee from an evil woman, From the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: Desire not her beauty in thy heart, And let her not take thee with her eyelids.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a harlot consumeth unto a cake of bread, And an adulteress the precious soul hunteth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doth a man take fire into his bosom, And are his garments not burnt?
speaker: Narrator

text: Doth a man walk on the hot coals, And are his feet not scorched?
speaker: Narrator

text: So [is] he who hath gone in unto the wife of his neighbour, None who doth touch her is innocent.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do not despise the thief, When he stealeth to fill his soul when he is hungry,
speaker: Narrator

text: And being found he repayeth sevenfold, All the substance of his house he giveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who committeth adultery [with] a woman lacketh heart, He is destroying his soul who doth it.
speaker: Narrator

text: A stroke and shame he doth find, And his reproach is not wiped away,
speaker: Narrator

text: For jealousy [is] the fury of a man, And he doth not spare in a day of vengeance.
speaker: Narrator

text: He accepteth not the appearance of any atonement, Yea, he doth not consent, Though thou dost multiply bribes!
speaker: Narrator

text: My son! keep my sayings, And my commands lay up with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep my commands, and live, And my law as the pupil of thine eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bind them on thy fingers, Write them on the tablet of thy heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to wisdom, `My sister Thou [art].' And cry to understanding, `Kinswoman!'
speaker: Narrator

text: To preserve thee from a strange woman, From a stranger who hath made smooth her sayings.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, at a window of my house, Through my casement I have looked out,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I do see among the simple ones, I discern among the sons, A young man lacking understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text: Passing on in the street, near her corner, And the way [to] her house he doth step,
speaker: Narrator

text: In the twilight -- in the evening of day, In the darkness of night and blackness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, lo, a woman to meet him -- (A harlot's dress, and watchful of heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: Noisy she [is], and stubborn, In her house her feet rest not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in an out-place, now in broad places, And near every corner she lieth in wait) --
speaker: Narrator

text: And she laid hold on him, and kissed him, She hath hardened her face, and saith to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: `Sacrifices of peace-offerings [are] by me, To-day I have completed my vows.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I have come forth to meet thee, To seek earnestly thy face, and I find thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: [With] ornamental coverings I decked my couch, Carved works -- cotton of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sprinkled my bed -- myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, we are filled [with] loves till the morning, We delight ourselves in loves.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the man is not in his house, He hath gone on a long journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: A bag of money he hath taken in his hand, At the day of the new moon he cometh to his house.'
speaker: Narrator

text: She turneth him aside with the abundance of her speech, With the flattery of her lips she forceth him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is going after her straightway, As an ox unto the slaughter he cometh, And as a fetter unto the chastisement of a fool,
speaker: Narrator

text: Till an arrow doth split his liver, As a bird hath hastened unto a snare, And hath not known that it [is] for its life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, ye sons, hearken to me, And give attention to sayings of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not thy heart turn unto her ways, Do not wander in her paths,
speaker: Narrator

text: For many [are] the wounded she caused to fall, And mighty [are] all her slain ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ways of Sheol -- her house, Going down unto inner chambers of death!
speaker: Narrator

text: Doth not wisdom call? And understanding give forth her voice?
speaker: Narrator

text: At the head of high places by the way, Between the paths she hath stood,
speaker: Narrator

text: At the side of the gates, at the mouth of the city, The entrance of the openings, she crieth aloud,
speaker: Narrator

text: `Unto you, O men, I call, And my voice [is] unto the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand, ye simple ones, prudence, And ye fools, understand the heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken, for noble things I speak, And the opening of my lips [is] uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For truth doth my mouth utter, And an abomination to my lips [is] wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: In righteousness [are] all the sayings of my mouth, Nothing in them is froward and perverse.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of them [are] plain to the intelligent, And upright to those finding knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Receive my instruction, and not silver, And knowledge rather than choice gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: For better [is] wisdom than rubies, Yea, all delights are not comparable with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, wisdom, have dwelt with prudence, And a knowledge of devices I find out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of Jehovah [is] to hate evil; Pride, and arrogance, and an evil way, And a froward mouth, I have hated.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine [is] counsel and substance, I [am] understanding, I have might.
speaker: Narrator

text: By me kings reign, and princes decree righteousness,
speaker: Narrator

text: By me do chiefs rule, and nobles, All judges of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I love those loving me, And those seeking me earnestly do find me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wealth and honour [are] with me, Lasting substance and righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better [is] my fruit than gold, even fine gold, And mine increase than choice silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a path of righteousness I cause to walk, In midst of paths of judgment,
speaker: Narrator

text: To cause my lovers to inherit substance, Yea, their treasures I fill.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah possessed me -- the beginning of His way, Before His works since then.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the age I was anointed, from the first, From former states of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In there being no depths, I was brought forth, In there being no fountains heavy [with] waters,
speaker: Narrator

text: Before mountains were sunk, Before heights, I was brought forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: While He had not made the earth, and out-places, And the top of the dusts of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: In His preparing the heavens I [am] there, In His decreeing a circle on the face of the deep,
speaker: Narrator

text: In His strengthening clouds above, In His making strong fountains of the deep,
speaker: Narrator

text: In His setting for the sea its limit, And the waters transgress not His command, In His decreeing the foundations of earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I am near Him, a workman, And I am a delight -- day by day. Rejoicing before Him at all times,
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoicing in the habitable part of His earth, And my delights [are] with the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, ye sons, hearken to me, Yea, happy are they who keep my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear instruction, and be wise, and slight not.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of the man hearkening to me, To watch at my doors day by day, To watch at the door-posts of my entrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoso is finding me, hath found life, And bringeth out good-will from Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoso is missing me, is wronging his soul, All hating me have loved death!
speaker: Narrator

text: Wisdom hath builded her house, She hath hewn out her pillars -- seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: She hath slaughtered her slaughter, She hath mingled her wine, Yea, she hath arranged her table.
speaker: Narrator

text: She hath sent forth her damsels, She crieth on the tops of the high places of the city:
speaker: Narrator

text: `Who [is] simple? let him turn aside hither.' Whoso lacketh heart: she hath said to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: `Come, eat of my bread, And drink of the wine I have mingled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forsake ye, the simple, and live, And be happy in the way of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: The instructor of a scorner Is receiving for it -- shame, And a reprover of the wicked -- his blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee, Give reproof to the wise, and he loveth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to the wise, and he is wiser still, Make known to the righteous, And he increaseth learning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The commencement of wisdom [is] the fear of Jehovah, And a knowledge of the Holy Ones [is] understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by me do thy days multiply, And added to thee are years of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou hast been wise, thou hast been wise for thyself, And thou hast scorned -- thyself bearest [it].
speaker: Narrator

text: A foolish woman [is] noisy, Simple, and hath not known what.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she hath sat at the opening of her house, On a throne -- the high places of the city,
speaker: Narrator

text: To call to those passing by the way, Who are going straight [on] their paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Who [is] simple? let him turn aside hither.' And whoso lacketh heart -- she said to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: `Stolen waters are sweet, And hidden bread is pleasant.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hath not known that Rephaim [are] there, In deep places of Sheol her invited ones!
speaker: Narrator

text: Proverbs of Solomon. A wise son causeth a father to rejoice, And a foolish son [is] an affliction to his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Treasures of wickedness profit not, And righteousness delivereth from death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah causeth not the soul of the righteous to hunger, And the desire of the wicked He thrusteth away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Poor [is] he who is working -- a slothful hand, And the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is gathering in summer [is] a wise son, Whoso is sleeping in harvest [is] a son causing shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessings [are] for the head of the righteous, And the mouth of the wicked cover doth violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: The remembrance of the righteous [is] for a blessing, And the name of the wicked doth rot.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise in heart accepteth commands, And a talkative fool kicketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is walking in integrity walketh confidently, And whoso is perverting his ways is known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is winking the eye giveth grief, And a talkative fool kicketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fountain of life [is] the mouth of the righteous, And the mouth of the wicked cover doth violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hatred awaketh contentions, And over all transgressions love covereth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the lips of the intelligent is wisdom found, And a rod [is] for the back of him who is lacking understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise lay up knowledge, and the mouth of a fool [is] near ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wealth of the rich [is] his strong city, The ruin of the poor [is] their poverty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wage of the righteous [is] for life, The increase of the wicked for sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: A traveller to life [is] he who is keeping instruction, And whoso is forsaking rebuke is erring.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is covering hatred with lying lips, And whoso is bringing out an evil report is a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the abundance of words transgression ceaseth not, And whoso is restraining his lips [is] wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tongue of the righteous [is] chosen silver, The heart of the wicked -- as a little thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lips of the righteous delight many, And fools for lack of heart die.
speaker: Narrator

text: The blessing of Jehovah -- it maketh rich, And He addeth no grief with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: To execute inventions [is] as play to a fool, And wisdom to a man of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: The feared thing of the wicked it meeteth him, And the desire of the righteous is given.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the passing by of a hurricane, So the wicked is not, And the righteous is a foundation age-during.
speaker: Narrator

text: As vinegar to the teeth, And as smoke to the eyes, So [is] the slothful to those sending him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of Jehovah addeth days, And the years of the wicked are shortened.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hope of the righteous [is] joyful, And the expectation of the wicked perisheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of Jehovah [is] strength to the perfect, And ruin to workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous to the age is not moved, And the wicked inhabit not the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mouth of the righteous uttereth wisdom, And the tongue of frowardness is cut out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lips of the righteous know a pleasing thing, And the mouth of the wicked perverseness!
speaker: Narrator

text: Balances of deceit [are] an abomination to Jehovah, And a perfect weight [is] His delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pride hath come, and shame cometh, And with the lowly [is] wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: The integrity of the upright leadeth them, And the perverseness of the treacherous destroyeth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wealth profiteth not in a day of wrath, And righteousness delivereth from death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteousness of the perfect maketh right his way, And by his wickedness doth the wicked fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteousness of the upright delivereth them, And in mischief the treacherous are captured.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the death of a wicked man, hope perisheth, And the expectation of the iniquitous hath been lost.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous from distress is drawn out, And the wicked goeth in instead of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the mouth a hypocrite corrupteth his friend, And by knowledge the righteous are drawn out.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the good of the righteous a city exulteth, And in the destruction of the wicked [is] singing.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the blessing of the upright is a city exalted, And by the mouth of the wicked thrown down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is despising his neighbour lacketh heart, And a man of understanding keepeth silence.
speaker: Narrator

text: A busybody is revealing secret counsel, And the faithful of spirit is covering the matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Without counsels do a people fall, And deliverance [is] in a multitude of counsellors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Evil [one] suffereth when he hath been surety [for] a stranger, And whoso is hating suretyship is confident.
speaker: Narrator

text: A gracious woman retaineth honour, And terrible [men] retain riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: A kind man is rewarding his own soul, And the fierce is troubling his own flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked is getting a lying wage, And whoso is sowing righteousness -- a true reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rightly [is] righteousness for life, And whoso is pursuing evil -- for his own death.
speaker: Narrator

text: An abomination to Jehovah [are] the perverse of heart, And the perfect of the way [are] His delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hand to hand, the wicked is not acquitted, And the seed of the righteous hath escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text: A ring of gold in the nose of a sow -- A fair woman and stubborn of behaviour.
speaker: Narrator

text: The desire of the righteous [is] only good, The hope of the wicked [is] transgression.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is who is scattering, and yet is increased, And who is keeping back from uprightness, only to want.
speaker: Narrator

text: A liberal soul is made fat, And whoso is watering, he also is watered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is withholding corn, the people execrate him, And a blessing [is] for the head of him who is selling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is earnestly seeking good Seeketh a pleasing thing, And whoso is seeking evil -- it meeteth him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is confident in his wealth he falleth, And as a leaf, the righteous flourish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is troubling his own house inheriteth wind, And a servant [is] the fool to the wise of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fruit of the righteous [is] a tree of life, And whoso is taking souls [is] wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, the righteous in the earth is recompensed, Surely also the wicked and the sinner!
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is loving instruction, is loving knowledge, And whoso is hating reproof [is] brutish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The good bringeth forth favour from Jehovah, And the man of wicked devices He condemneth.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man is not established by wickedness, And the root of the righteous is not moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: A virtuous woman [is] a crown to her husband, And as rottenness in his bones [is] one causing shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: The thoughts of the righteous [are] justice, The counsels of the wicked -- deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of the wicked [are]: `Lay wait for blood,' And the mouth of the upright delivereth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Overthrow the wicked, and they are not, And the house of the righteous standeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to his wisdom is a man praised, And the perverted of heart becometh despised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better [is] the lightly esteemed who hath a servant, Than the self-honoured who lacketh bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous knoweth the life of his beast, And the mercies of the wicked [are] cruel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is tilling the ground is satisfied [with] bread, And whoso is pursuing vanities is lacking heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked hath desired the net of evil doers, And the root of the righteous giveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In transgression of the lips [is] the snare of the wicked, And the righteous goeth out from distress.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the fruit of the mouth [is] one satisfied [with] good, And the deed of man's hands returneth to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of a fool [is] right in his own eyes, And whoso is hearkening to counsel [is] wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fool -- in a day is his anger known, And the prudent is covering shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso uttereth faithfulness declareth righteousness, And a false witness -- deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: A rash speaker is like piercings of a sword, And the tongue of the wise is healing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lip of truth is established for ever, And for a moment -- a tongue of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deceit [is] in the heart of those devising evil, And to those counselling peace [is] joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: No iniquity is desired by the righteous, And the wicked have been full of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: An abomination to Jehovah [are] lying lips, And stedfast doers [are] his delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: A prudent man is concealing knowledge, And the heart of fools proclaimeth folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hand of the diligent ruleth, And slothfulness becometh tributary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sorrow in the heart of a man boweth down, And a good word maketh him glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous searcheth his companion, And the way of the wicked causeth them to err.
speaker: Narrator

text: The slothful roasteth not his hunting, And the wealth of a diligent man is precious.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the path of righteousness [is] life, And in the way of [that] path [is] no death!
speaker: Narrator

text: A wise son -- the instruction of a father, And a scorner -- he hath not heard rebuke.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the fruit of the mouth a man eateth good, And the soul of the treacherous -- violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is keeping his mouth, is keeping his soul, Whoso is opening wide his lips -- ruin to him!
speaker: Narrator

text: The soul of the slothful is desiring, and hath not. And the soul of the diligent is made fat.
speaker: Narrator

text: A false word the righteous hateth, And the wicked causeth abhorrence, and is confounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteousness keepeth him who is perfect in the way, And wickedness overthroweth a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is who is making himself rich, and hath nothing, Who is making himself poor, and wealth [is] abundant.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ransom of a man's life [are] his riches, And the poor hath not heard rebuke.
speaker: Narrator

text: The light of the righteous rejoiceth, And the lamp of the wicked is extinguished.
speaker: Narrator

text: A vain man through pride causeth debate, And with the counselled [is] wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wealth from vanity becometh little, And whoso is gathering by the hand becometh great.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hope prolonged is making the heart sick, And a tree of life [is] the coming desire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is despising the Word is destroyed for it, And whoso is fearing the Command is repayed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law of the wise [is] a fountain of life, To turn aside from snares of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good understanding giveth grace, And the way of the treacherous [is] hard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every prudent one dealeth with knowledge, And a fool spreadeth out folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wicked messenger falleth into evil, And a faithful ambassador is healing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is refusing instruction -- poverty and shame, And whoso is observing reproof is honoured.
speaker: Narrator

text: A desire accomplished is sweet to the soul, And an abomination to fools [is]: Turn from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is walking with wise men is wise, And a companion of fools suffereth evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Evil pursueth sinners, And good recompenseth the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: A good man causeth sons' sons to inherit, And laid up for the righteous [is] the sinner's wealth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abundance of food -- the tillage of the poor, And substance is consumed without judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is sparing his rod is hating his son, And whoso is loving him hath hastened him chastisement.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous is eating to the satiety of his soul, And the belly of the wicked lacketh!
speaker: Narrator

text: Every wise woman hath builded her house, And the foolish with her hands breaketh it down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is walking in his uprightness is fearing Jehovah, And the perverted [in] his ways is despising Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the mouth of a fool [is] a rod of pride, And the lips of the wise preserve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Without oxen a stall [is] clean, And great [is] the increase by the power of the ox.
speaker: Narrator

text: A faithful witness lieth not, And a false witness breatheth out lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: A scorner hath sought wisdom, and it is not, And knowledge to the intelligent [is] easy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go from before a foolish man, Or thou hast not known the lips of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wisdom of the prudent [is] to understand his way, And the folly of fools [is] deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fools mock at a guilt-offering, And among the upright -- a pleasing thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart knoweth its own bitterness, And with its joy a stranger doth not intermeddle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The house of the wicked is destroyed, And the tent of the upright flourisheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a way -- right before a man, And its latter end [are] ways of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even in laughter is the heart pained, And the latter end of joy [is] affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: From his ways is the backslider in heart filled, And a good man -- from his fruits.
speaker: Narrator

text: The simple giveth credence to everything, And the prudent attendeth to his step.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise is fearing and turning from evil, And a fool is transgressing and is confident.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is short of temper doth folly, And a man of wicked devices is hated.
speaker: Narrator

text: The simple have inherited folly, And the prudent are crowned [with] knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: The evil have bowed down before the good, And the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even of his neighbour is the poor hated, And those loving the rich [are] many.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is despising his neighbour sinneth, Whoso is favouring the humble, O his happiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not they err who are devising evil? And kindness and truth [are] to those devising good,
speaker: Narrator

text: In all labour there is advantage, And a thing of the lips [is] only to want.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crown of the wise is their wealth, The folly of fools [is] folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: A true witness is delivering souls, And a deceitful one breatheth out lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the fear of Jehovah [is] strong confidence, And to His sons there is a refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of Jehovah [is] a fountain of life, To turn aside from snares of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the multitude of a people [is] the honour of a king, And in lack of people the ruin of a prince.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is slow to anger [is] of great understanding, And whoso is short in temper is exalting folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: A healed heart [is] life to the flesh, And rottenness to the bones [is] envy.
speaker: Narrator

text: An oppressor of the poor reproacheth his Maker, And whoso is honouring Him Is favouring the needy.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his wickedness is the wicked driven away, And trustful in his death [is] the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the heart of the intelligent wisdom doth rest. And in the midst of fools it is known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteousness exalteth a nation, And the goodliness of peoples [is] a sin-offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The favour of a king [is] to a wise servant, And an object of his wrath is one causing shame!
speaker: Narrator

text: A soft answer turneth back fury, And a grievous word raiseth up anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tongue of the wise maketh knowledge good, And the mouth of fools uttereth folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: In every place are the eyes of Jehovah, Watching the evil and the good.
speaker: Narrator

text: A healed tongue [is] a tree of life, And perverseness in it -- a breach in the spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fool despiseth the instruction of his father, And whoso is regarding reproof is prudent.
speaker: Narrator

text: [In] the house of the righteous [is] abundant strength, And in the increase of the wicked -- trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lips of the wise scatter knowledge, And the heart of fools [is] not right.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sacrifice of the wicked [is] an abomination to Jehovah, And the prayer of the upright [is] His delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: An abomination to Jehovah [is] the way of the wicked, And whoso is pursuing righteousness He loveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chastisement [is] grievous to him who is forsaking the path, Whoso is hating reproof dieth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sheol and destruction [are] before Jehovah, Surely also the hearts of the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: A scorner loveth not his reprover, Unto the wise he goeth not.
speaker: Narrator

text: A joyful heart maketh glad the face, And by grief of heart is the spirit smitten.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart of the intelligent seeketh knowledge, And the mouth of fools enjoyeth folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the days of the afflicted [are] evil, And gladness of heart [is] a perpetual banquet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better [is] a little with the fear of Jehovah, Than much treasure, and tumult with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better [is] an allowance of green herbs and love there, Than a fatted ox, and hatred with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man of fury stirreth up contention, And the slow to anger appeaseth strife.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of the slothful [is] as a hedge of briers, And the path of the upright is raised up.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wise son rejoiceth a father. And a foolish man is despising his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Folly is joy to one lacking heart, And a man of intelligence directeth [his] going.
speaker: Narrator

text: Without counsel [is] the making void of purposes, And in a multitude of counsellors it is established.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joy [is] to a man in the answer of his mouth, And a word in its season -- how good!
speaker: Narrator

text: A path of life [is] on high for the wise, To turn aside from Sheol beneath.
speaker: Narrator

text: The house of the proud Jehovah pulleth down, And He setteth up the border of the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: An abomination to Jehovah [are] thoughts of wickedness, And pure [are] sayings of pleasantness.
speaker: Narrator

text: A dishonest gainer is troubling his house, And whoso is hating gifts liveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart of the righteous meditateth to answer, And the mouth of the wicked uttereth evil things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Far [is] Jehovah from the wicked, And the prayer of the righteous He heareth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart, A good report maketh fat the bone.
speaker: Narrator

text: An ear that is hearing the reproof of life Doth lodge among the wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is refusing instruction is despising his soul, And whoso is hearing reproof Is getting understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of Jehovah [is] the instruction of wisdom, And before honour [is] humility!
speaker: Narrator

text: Of man [are] arrangements of the heart, And from Jehovah an answer of the tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes, And Jehovah is pondering the spirits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Roll unto Jehovah thy works, And established are thy purposes,
speaker: Narrator

text: All things hath Jehovah wrought for Himself, And also the wicked [worketh] for a day of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: An abomination to Jehovah [is] every proud one of heart, Hand to hand he is not acquitted.
speaker: Narrator

text: In kindness and truth pardoned is iniquity, And in the fear of Jehovah Turn thou aside from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man's ways please Jehovah, even his enemies, He causeth to be at peace with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better [is] a little with righteousness, Than abundance of increase without justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart of man deviseth his way, And Jehovah establisheth his step.
speaker: Narrator

text: An oath [is] on the lips of a king, In judgment his mouth trespasseth not.
speaker: Narrator

text: A just beam and balances [are] Jehovah's, His work [are] all the stones of the bag.
speaker: Narrator

text: An abomination to kings [is] doing wickedness, For by righteousness is a throne established.
speaker: Narrator

text: The delight of kings [are] righteous lips, And whoso is speaking uprightly he loveth,
speaker: Narrator

text: The fury of a king [is] messengers of death, And a wise man pacifieth it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the light of a king's face [is] life, And his good-will [is] as a cloud of the latter rain.
speaker: Narrator

text: To get wisdom -- how much better than gold, And to get understanding to be chosen than silver!
speaker: Narrator

text: A highway of the upright [is], `Turn from evil,' Whoso is preserving his soul is watching his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before destruction [is] pride, And before stumbling -- a haughty spirit.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Better is humility of spirit with the poor, Than to apportion spoil with the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise in any matter findeth good, And whoso is trusting in Jehovah, O his happiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the wise in heart is called, `Intelligent,' And sweetness of lips increaseth learning.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fountain of life [is] understanding to its possessors, The instruction of fools is folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart of the wise causeth his mouth to act wisely, And by his lips he increaseth learning,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sayings of pleasantness [are] a honeycomb, Sweet to the soul, and healing to the bone.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a way right before a man, And its latter end -- ways of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: A labouring man hath laboured for himself, For his mouth hath caused [him] to bend over it.
speaker: Narrator

text: A worthless man is preparing evil, And on his lips -- as a burning fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: A froward man sendeth forth contention, A tale-bearer is separating a familiar friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: A violent man enticeth his neighbour, And hath causeth him to go in a way not good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consulting his eyes to devise froward things, Moving his lips he hath accomplished evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: A crown of beauty [are] grey hairs, In the way of righteousness it is found.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better [is] the slow to anger than the mighty, And the ruler over his spirit than he who is taking a city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Into the centre is the lot cast, And from Jehovah [is] all its judgment!
speaker: Narrator

text: Better [is] a dry morsel, and rest with it, Than a house full of the sacrifices of strife.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wise servant ruleth over a son causing shame, And in the midst of brethren He apportioneth an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: A refining pot [is] for silver, and a furnace for gold, And the trier of hearts [is] Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: An evil doer is attentive to lips of vanity, Falsehood is giving ear to a mischievous tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is mocking at the poor Hath reproached his Maker, Whoso is rejoicing at calamity is not acquitted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sons' sons [are] the crown of old men, And the glory of sons [are] their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not comely for a fool is a lip of excellency, Much less for a noble a lip of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: A stone of grace [is] the bribe in the eyes of its possessors, Whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is covering transgression is seeking love, And whoso is repeating a matter Is separating a familiar friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rebuke cometh down on the intelligent More than a hundred stripes on a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text: An evil man seeketh only rebellion, And a fierce messenger is sent against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The meeting of a bereaved bear by a man, And -- not a fool in his folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is returning evil for good, Evil moveth not from his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: The beginning of contention [is] a letting out of waters, And before it is meddled with leave the strife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is justifying the wicked, And condemning the righteous, Even both of these [are] an abomination to Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why [is] this -- a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, And a heart there is none?
speaker: Narrator

text: At all times is the friend loving, And a brother for adversity is born.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man lacking heart is striking hands, A surety he becometh before his friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is loving transgression is loving debate, Whoso is making high his entrance is seeking destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: The perverse of heart findeth not good, And the turned in his tongue falleth into evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is begetting a fool hath affliction for it, Yea, the father of a fool rejoiceth not.
speaker: Narrator

text: A rejoicing heart doth good to the body, And a smitten spirit drieth the bone.
speaker: Narrator

text: A bribe from the bosom the wicked taketh, To turn aside the paths of judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The face of the intelligent [is] to wisdom, And the eyes of a fool -- at the end of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: A provocation to his father [is] a foolish son, And bitterness to her that bare him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, to fine the righteous is not good, To smite nobles for uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: One acquainted with knowledge is sparing his words, And the cool of temper [is] a man of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even a fool keeping silence is reckoned wise, He who is shutting his lips intelligent!
speaker: Narrator

text: For [an object of] desire he who is separated doth seek, With all wisdom he intermeddleth.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fool delighteth not in understanding, But -- in uncovering his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the coming of the wicked come also hath contempt, And with shame -- reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deep waters [are] the words of a man's mouth, The fountain of wisdom [is] a flowing brook.
speaker: Narrator

text: Acceptance of the face of the wicked [is] not good, To turn aside the righteous in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lips of a fool enter into strife, And his mouth for stripes calleth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mouth of a fool [is] ruin to him, And his lips [are] the snare of his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of a tale-bearer [are] as self-inflicted wounds, And they have gone down [to] the inner parts of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also that is remiss in his work, A brother he [is] to a destroyer.
speaker: Narrator

text: A tower of strength [is] the name of Jehovah, Into it the righteous runneth, and is set on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wealth of the rich [is] the city of his strength, And as a wall set on high in his own imagination.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before destruction the heart of man is high, And before honour [is] humility.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is answering a matter before he heareth, Folly it is to him and shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: The spirit of a man sustaineth his sickness, And a smitten spirit who doth bear?
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart of the intelligent getteth knowledge, And the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gift of a man maketh room for him, And before the great it leadeth him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteous [is] the first in his own cause, His neighbour cometh and hath searched him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lot causeth contentions to cease, And between the mighty it separateth.
speaker: Narrator

text: A brother transgressed against is as a strong city, And contentions as the bar of a palace.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the fruit of a man's mouth is his belly satisfied, [From the] increase of his lips he is satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: Death and life [are] in the power of the tongue, And those loving it eat its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: [Whoso] hath found a wife hath found good, And bringeth out good-will from Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: [With] supplications doth the poor speak, And the rich answereth fierce things.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man with friends [is] to show himself friendly, And there is a lover adhering more than a brother!
speaker: Narrator

text: Better [is] the poor walking in his integrity, Than the perverse [in] his lips, who [is] a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, without knowledge the soul [is] not good, And the hasty in feet is sinning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The folly of man perverteth his way, And against Jehovah is his heart wroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wealth addeth many friends, And the poor from his neighbour is separated.
speaker: Narrator

text: A false witness is not acquitted, Whoso breatheth out lies is not delivered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many entreat the face of the noble, And all have made friendship to a man of gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the brethren of the poor have hated him, Surely also his friends have been far from him, He is pursuing words -- they are not!
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is getting heart is loving his soul, He is keeping understanding to find good.
speaker: Narrator

text: A false witness is not acquitted, And whoso breatheth out lies perisheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Luxury is not comely for a fool, Much less for a servant to rule among princes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wisdom of a man hath deferred his anger, And his glory [is] to pass over transgression.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wrath of a king [is] a growl as of a young lion, And as dew on the herb his good-will.
speaker: Narrator

text: A calamity to his father [is] a foolish son, And the contentions of a wife [are] a continual dropping.
speaker: Narrator

text: House and wealth [are] the inheritance of fathers, And from Jehovah [is] an understanding wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sloth causeth deep sleep to fall, And an indolent soul doth hunger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is keeping the command is keeping his soul, Whoso is despising His ways dieth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is lending [to] Jehovah is favouring the poor, And his deed He repayeth to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chastise thy son, for there is hope, And to put him to death lift not up thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man of great wrath is bearing punishment, For, if thou dost deliver, yet again thou dost add.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear counsel and receive instruction, So that thou art wise in thy latter end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many [are] the purposes in a man's heart, And the counsel of Jehovah it standeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The desirableness of a man [is] his kindness, And better [is] the poor than a liar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of Jehovah [is] to life, And satisfied he remaineth -- he is not charged with evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: The slothful hath hidden his hand in a dish, Even unto his mouth he bringeth it not back.
speaker: Narrator

text: A scorner smite, and the simple acts prudently, And give reproof to the intelligent, He understandeth knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is spoiling a father causeth a mother to flee, A son causing shame, and bringing confusion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cease, my son, to hear instruction -- To err from sayings of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: A worthless witness scorneth judgment, And the mouth of the wicked swalloweth iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judgments have been prepared for scorners, And stripes for the back of fools!
speaker: Narrator

text: Wine [is] a scorner -- strong drink [is] noisy, And any going astray in it is not wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of a king [is] a growl as of a young lion, He who is causing him to be wroth is wronging his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: An honour to a man is cessation from strife, And every fool intermeddleth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of winter the slothful plougheth not, He asketh in harvest, and there is nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Counsel in the heart of a man [is] deep water, And a man of understanding draweth it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: A multitude of men proclaim each his kindness, And a man of stedfastness who doth find?
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous is walking habitually in his integrity, O the happiness of his sons after him!
speaker: Narrator

text: A king sitting on a throne of judgment, Is scattering with his eyes all evil,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who saith, `I have purified my heart, I have been cleansed from my sin?'
speaker: Narrator

text: A stone and a stone, an ephah and an ephah, Even both of them [are] an abomination to Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even by his actions a youth maketh himself known, Whether his work be pure or upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: A hearing ear, and a seeing eye, Jehovah hath made even both of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Love not sleep, lest thou become poor, Open thine eyes -- be satisfied [with] bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Bad, bad,' saith the buyer, And going his way then he boasteth himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Substance, gold, and a multitude of rubies, Yea, a precious vessel, [are] lips of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take his garment when a stranger hath been surety, And for strangers pledge it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sweet to a man [is] the bread of falsehood, And afterwards is his mouth filled [with] gravel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Purposes by counsel thou dost establish, And with plans make thou war.
speaker: Narrator

text: A revealer of secret counsels is the busybody, And for a deceiver [with] his lips make not thyself surety.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is vilifying his father and his mother, Extinguished is his lamp in blackness of darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: An inheritance gotten wrongly at first, Even its latter end is not blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not say, `I recompense evil,' Wait for Jehovah, and He delivereth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: An abomination to Jehovah [are] a stone and a stone, And balances of deceit [are] not good.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Jehovah [are] the steps of a man, And man -- how understandeth he his way?
speaker: Narrator

text: A snare to a man [is] he hath swallowed a holy thing, And after vows to make inquiry.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wise king is scattering the wicked, And turneth back on them the wheel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The breath of man [is] a lamp of Jehovah, Searching all the inner parts of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kindness and truth keep a king, And he hath supported by kindness his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: The beauty of young men is their strength, And the honour of old men is grey hairs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bandages of a wound thou removest with the evil, Also the plagues of the inner parts of the heart!
speaker: Narrator

text: Rivulets of waters [is] the heart of a king in the hand of Jehovah, Wherever He pleaseth He inclineth it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every way of a man [is] right in his own eyes, And Jehovah is pondering hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: To do righteousness and judgment, Is chosen of Jehovah rather than sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Loftiness of eyes, and breadth of heart, Tillage of the wicked [is] sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The purposes of the diligent [are] only to advantage, And of every hasty one, only to want.
speaker: Narrator

text: The making of treasures by a lying tongue, [Is] a vanity driven away of those seeking death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The spoil of the wicked catcheth them, Because they have refused to do judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Froward [is] the way of a man who is vile, And the pure -- upright [is] his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better to sit on a corner of the roof, Than [with] a woman of contentions and a house of company.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soul of the wicked hath desired evil, Not gracious in his eyes is his neighbour.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the scorner is punished, the simple becometh wise, And in giving understanding to the wise He receiveth knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Righteous One is acting wisely Towards the house of the wicked, He is overthrowing the wicked for wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is shutting his ear from the cry of the poor, He also doth cry, and is not answered.
speaker: Narrator

text: A gift in secret pacifieth anger, And a bribe in the bosom strong fury.
speaker: Narrator

text: To do justice [is] joy to the righteous, But ruin to workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man who is wandering from the way of understanding, In an assembly of Rephaim resteth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso [is] loving mirth [is] a poor man, Whoso is loving wine and oil maketh no wealth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked [is] an atonement for the righteous, And for the upright the treacherous dealer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better to dwell in a wilderness land, Than [with] a woman of contentions and anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: A treasure to be desired, and oil, [Is] in the habitation of the wise, And a foolish man swalloweth it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is pursuing righteousness and kindness, Findeth life, righteousness, and honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: A city of the mighty hath the wise gone up, And bringeth down the strength of its confidence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is keeping his mouth and his tongue, Is keeping from adversities his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Proud, haughty, scorner [is] his name, Who is working in the wrath of pride.
speaker: Narrator

text: The desire of the slothful slayeth him, For his hands have refused to work.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the day desiring he hath desired, And the righteous giveth and withholdeth not.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sacrifice of the wicked [is] abomination, Much more when in wickedness he bringeth it.
speaker: Narrator

text: A false witness doth perish, And an attentive man for ever speaketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wicked man hath hardened by his face, And the upright -- he prepareth his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no wisdom, nor understanding, Nor counsel, over-against Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: A horse is prepared for a day of battle, And the deliverance [is] of Jehovah!
speaker: Narrator

text: A name is chosen rather than much wealth, Than silver and than gold -- good grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rich and poor have met together, The Maker of them all [is] Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The prudent hath seen the evil, and is hidden, And the simple have passed on, and are punished.
speaker: Narrator

text: The end of humility [is] the fear of Jehovah, Riches, and honour, and life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thorns -- snares [are] in the way of the perverse, Whoso is keeping his soul is far from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give instruction to a youth about his way, Even when he is old he turneth not from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rich over the poor ruleth, And a servant [is] the borrower to the lender.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is sowing perverseness reapeth sorrow, And the rod of his anger weareth out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The good of eye -- he is blessed, For he hath given of his bread to the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast out a scorner -- and contention goeth out, And strife and shame cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is loving cleanness of heart, Grace [are] his lips, a king [is] his friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of Jehovah have kept knowledge, And He overthroweth the words of the treacherous.
speaker: Narrator

text: The slothful hath said, `A lion [is] without, In the midst of the broad places I am slain.'
speaker: Narrator

text: A deep pit [is] the mouth of strange women, The abhorred of Jehovah falleth there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Folly is bound up in the heart of a youth, The rod of chastisement putteth it far from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is oppressing the poor to multiply to him, He is giving to the rich -- only to want.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline thine ear, and hear words of the wise, And thy heart set to my knowledge,
speaker: Narrator

text: For they are pleasant when thou dost keep them in thy heart, They are prepared together for thy lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: That thy trust may be in Jehovah, I caused thee to know to-day, even thou.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have I not written to thee three times With counsels and knowledge?
speaker: Narrator

text: To cause thee to know the certainty of sayings of truth, To return sayings of truth to those sending thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rob not the poor because he [is] poor, And bruise not the afflicted in the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah pleadeth their cause, And hath spoiled the soul of their spoilers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shew not thyself friendly with an angry man, And with a man of fury go not in,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest thou learn his paths, And have received a snare to thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not thou among those striking hands, Among sureties [for] burdens.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou hast nothing to pay, Why doth he take thy bed from under thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove not a border of olden times, That thy fathers have made.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hast thou seen a man speedy in his business? Before kings he doth station himself, He stations not himself before obscure men!
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, Thou considerest diligently that which [is] before thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou hast put a knife to thy throat, If thou [art] a man of appetite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have no desire to his dainties, seeing it [is] lying food.
speaker: Narrator

text: Labour not to make wealth, From thine own understanding cease, Dost thou cause thine eyes to fly upon it? Then it is not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For wealth maketh to itself wings, As an eagle it flieth to the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eat not the bread of an evil eye, And have no desire to his dainties,
speaker: Narrator

text: For as he hath thought in his soul, so [is] he, `Eat and drink,' saith he to thee, And his heart [is] not with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy morsel thou hast eaten thou dost vomit up, And hast marred thy words that [are] sweet.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the ears of a fool speak not, For he treadeth on the wisdom of thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove not a border of olden times, And into fields of the fatherless enter not,
speaker: Narrator

text: For their Redeemer [is] strong, He doth plead their cause with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring in to instruction thy heart, And thine ear to sayings of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Withhold not from a youth chastisement, When thou smitest him with a rod he dieth not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou with a rod smitest him, And his soul from Sheol thou deliverest.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, if thy heart hath been wise, My heart rejoiceth, even mine,
speaker: Narrator

text: And my reins exult when thy lips speak uprightly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not thy heart be envious at sinners, But -- in the fear of Jehovah all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, is there a posterity? Then thy hope is not cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, And make happy in the way thy heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not thou among quaffers of wine, Among gluttonous ones of flesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: For the quaffer and glutton become poor, And drowsiness clotheth with rags.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken to thy father, who begat thee, And despise not thy mother when she hath become old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truth buy, and sell not, Wisdom, and instruction, and understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text: The father of the righteous rejoiceth greatly, The begetter of the wise rejoiceth in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice doth thy father and thy mother, Yea, she that bare thee is joyful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give, my son, thy heart to me, And let thine eyes watch my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a harlot [is] a deep ditch, And a strange woman [is] a strait pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: She also, as catching prey, lieth in wait, And the treacherous among men she increaseth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath wo? who hath sorrow? Who hath contentions? who hath plaint? Who hath wounds without cause? Who hath redness of eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text: Those tarrying by the wine, Those going in to search out mixed wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: See not wine when it showeth itself red, When it giveth in the cup its colour, It goeth up and down through the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its latter end -- as a serpent it biteth, And as a basilisk it stingeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine eyes see strange women, And thy heart speaketh perverse things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou hast been as one lying down in the heart of the sea, And as one lying down on the top of a mast.
speaker: Narrator

text: `They smote me, I have not been sick, They beat me, I have not known. When I awake -- I seek it yet again!'
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not envious of evil men, And desire not to be with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For destruction doth their heart meditate, And perverseness do their lips speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: By wisdom is a house builded, And by understanding it establisheth itself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by knowledge the inner parts are filled, [With] all precious and pleasant wealth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mighty [is] the wise in strength, And a man of knowledge is strengthening power,
speaker: Narrator

text: For by plans thou makest for thyself war, And deliverance [is] in a multitude of counsellors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wisdom [is] high for a fool, In the gate he openeth not his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is devising to do evil, Him they call a master of wicked thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The thought of folly [is] sin, And an abomination to man [is] a scorner.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast shewed thyself weak in a day of adversity, Straitened is thy power,
speaker: Narrator

text: If [from] delivering those taken to death, And those slipping to the slaughter -- thou keepest back.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou sayest, `Lo, we knew not this.' Is not the Ponderer of hearts He who understandeth? And the Keeper of thy soul He who knoweth? And He hath rendered to man according to his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eat my son, honey that [is] good, And the honeycomb -- sweet to thy palate.
speaker: Narrator

text: So [is] the knowledge of wisdom to thy soul, If thou hast found that there is a posterity And thy hope is not cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lay not wait, O wicked one, At the habitation of the righteous. Do not spoil his resting-place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For seven [times] doth the righteous fall and rise, And the wicked stumble in evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the falling of thine enemy rejoice not, And in his stumbling let not thy heart be joyful,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest Jehovah see, and [it be] evil in His eyes, And He hath turned from off him His anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fret not thyself at evil doers, Be not envious at the wicked,
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is not a posterity to the evil, The lamp of the wicked is extinguished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear Jehovah, my son, and the king, With changers mix not up thyself,
speaker: Narrator

text: For suddenly doth their calamity rise, And the ruin of them both -- who knoweth!
speaker: Narrator

text: These also are for the wise: -- To discern faces in judgment is not good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso is saying to the wicked, `Thou [art] righteous,' Peoples execrate him -- nations abhor him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to those reproving it is pleasant, And on them cometh a good blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lips he kisseth who is returning straightforward words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prepare in an out-place thy work, And make it ready in the field -- go afterwards, Then thou hast built thy house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not a witness for nought against thy neighbour, Or thou hast enticed with thy lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say not, `As he did to me, so I do to him, I render to each according to his work.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Near the field of a slothful man I passed by, And near the vineyard of a man lacking heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lo, it hath gone up -- all of it -- thorns! Covered its face have nettles, And its stone wall hath been broken down.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I see -- I -- I do set my heart, I have seen -- I have received instruction,
speaker: Narrator

text: A little sleep -- a little slumber -- A little folding of the hands to lie down.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy poverty hath come [as] a traveller, And thy want as an armed man!
speaker: Narrator

text: Also these are Proverbs of Solomon, that men of Hezekiah king of Judah transcribed: --
speaker: Narrator

text: The honour of God [is] to hide a thing, And the honour of kings to search out a matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens for height, and the earth for depth, And the heart of kings -- [are] unsearchable.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take away dross from silver, And a vessel for the refiner goeth forth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take away the wicked before a king, And established in righteousness is his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honour not thyself before a king, And in the place of the great stand not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For better [that] he hath said to thee, `Come thou up hither,' Than [that] he humble thee before a noble, Whom thine eyes have seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go not forth to strive, haste, turn, What dost thou in its latter end, When thy neighbour causeth thee to blush?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy cause plead with thy neighbour, And the secret counsel of another reveal not,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest the hearer put thee to shame, And thine evil report turn not back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Apples of gold in imagery of silver, [Is] the word spoken at its fit times.
speaker: Narrator

text: A ring of gold, and an ornament of pure gold, [Is] the wise reprover to an attentive ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a vessel of snow in a day of harvest, [So is] a faithful ambassador to those sending him, And the soul of his masters he refresheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Clouds and wind, and rain there is none, [Is] a man boasting himself in a false gift.
speaker: Narrator

text: By long-suffering is a ruler persuaded, And a soft tongue breaketh a bone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honey thou hast found -- eat thy sufficiency, Lest thou be satiated [with] it, and hast vomited it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house, Lest he be satiated [with] thee, and have hated thee.
